oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Freedom Sings - 2018-02-23
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Freedom Sings performances celebrating the First Amendment co-hosted by the Country Music Hall of Fame and the First Amendment Center at the CMA Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 23, 2018. Hosted by Ken Paulson. Includes band members Joseph Wooten, Sara Beck, Jonell Mosser, Dez Dickerson and Bill Lloyd. Includes recorded audio excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ken Paulson; Joseph Wooten; Sara Beck; Jonell Mosser; Dez Dickerson; Bill Lloyd;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (02:46) Opening comments from Ali Tonn and introduction of band members / (06:26) Performs Revolution (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (10:10) Ken Paulson with talks about freedom and music, songs of empowerment, songs about self image, and about songs fueling a social movement / (13:13) Performs This Little Light of Mine (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (14:40) Ken with comments about the civil rights movement and introduction of the next song / (15:38) Performs Happy Birthday (Unidentified with lead vocals) / (16:48) Ken talks about the new breed of singer/songwriters / (17:04) Performs Blowing In The Wind (Bill on lead vocals) / (19:32) Ken talks about the anti-war movement and the student shootings at Kent State University / (22:53) Performs Ohio (Bill on lead vocals) / (25:28) Ken talks about songs that promote social causes / (26:19) Performs Big Yellow Taxi (Unidentified with lead vocal) / (28:12) Ken talks about sexism in popular music / (29:49) Performs Johnny Get Angry (Unidentified on lead vocal) / (31:35) Ken talks about the previous song / (31:50) Ken talks about offensive songs / (32:20) Dez talks about the next song / (32:41) Performs (You're) Having My Baby (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (35:05) Ken talks about songs about women's rights / (35:56) Performs I Am Woman (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (37:58) Ken talks about the me too generation / (38:15) Performs Prayer (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (42:22) Ken talks about songs about truth / (43:05) Performs Coal Miner's Daughter (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (44:59) Ken talks about relating to songs about being 15 years old / (45:30) Performs Fifteen (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (50:24) Ken talks about controversy and popular music / (51:17) Performs Wake Up, Little Susie (Dez and Bill) / (52:45) Ken talks about people assuming drug references in songs / (53:53) Performs My Humps (Unidentified on lead vocal) / (54:41) Ken talks about political correctness and legislation about free speech / (56:04) Performs Short People (Bill and Unidentified on lead vocal) / (57:34) Ken talks about popular music and performing with two turntables, the creation of hip hop music and asks the audience question regarding where the phrase hip hop originated / (01:01:01) Plays excerpted recorded of the song Rapper's Delight / (01:01:15) Ken talks about sampling / (01:02:20) Plays excerpted recording of the song A Change Is Gonna Come by DMX / (01:02:38) Ken talks about Sam Cooke / (01:03:51) Performs A Change Is Gonna Come (Unidentified on lead vocals) / (01:06:50) Ken talks about songs about protest / (01:07:38) Performs This Land Is Your Land / (01:11:02) Closing comments from Ken / (01:11:16) Walk-out music / (01:11:40) Comments from Ali Tonn / (01:13:35) Ken answers question about not performing songs from the play Hamilton / (01:15:05) Ken answers question about not performing songs by the band Rage Against The Machine / (01:15:48) Ali answers question about Kenny Chesney being represented in the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum / (01:16:55) Ken answers question about the Freedom Sings program / (01:18:01) Ali dismisses the Cane Ridge High School students / (01:18:18) Dez answers question about his Stratocaster guitar and playing in Prince's band / (01:19:36) Ali dismisses the Houston County students / (01:20:00) Johnny Wooten talks about his career / (01:20:31) Jonell talks about her career / (01:21:19) Dez talks about his career / (01:21:34) Bill talks about his career / (01:22:15) Sara talks about her career / (01:23:13) Ali thanks the audience / (01:23:38) Ken answers question about his inspiration to start this program / (01:24:51) Audience member suggests artists that this program should consider / (01:26:45) Johnny comments on the importance of the First Amendment / (01:28:15) Dismissal of Community High School students / (01:28:36) Bill answers question about his favorite Beatles album / (01:29:24) Bill and Dez talk about people still being interested in the Beatles / (01:30:35) Ken gives a shout out to Middle Tennessee State University / (01:31:17) Ken is asked what are his favorite songs / (01:31:52) Ken is asked about vinyl records and record stores / (01:32:45) Ali with final comments / (01:33:24) End of program /
